headline: Post-OPEC Angola: The Quota’s Gone, the Decline Isn’t
summary: The government stopped publishing official output figures after November 2023, just weeks before its departure became effective in January 2024, but exports tell the story.

headline: Oil Rallies on Trump Sanctions. Traders See a Head-Fake.
summary: Oil prices were rallying Thursday after President Donald Trump imposed sanctions on Russian producers Rosneft and Lukoil.  Brent  crude futures, the international benchmark, rose 5.9% to $66.29 a barrel.  West Texas Intermediate (  WTI  ) was up 6.3% to $62.17 a barrel, its largest gain since June.

headline: 3 Integrated Energy Stocks Standing Tall Despite Soft Oil Price
summary: Rising demand for renewable energy is adding uncertainty to the Zacks Oil and Gas Integrated International industry's outlook. XOM, CVX and BP will probably overcome market challenges.

headline: Shares in Oil Companies Advance
summary: Shares of global energy companies rose after the U.S. imposed substantial new sanctions on Russia's oil giants, boosting benchmark crude-oil and natural-gas prices.    In the U.S., shares of Exxon Mobil (XOM), Occidental Petroleum (OXY) and Chevron (CVX) rose in morning trading.

headline: Wall Street drifts higher toward records as oil companies, tech stocks gain ground
summary: U.S. stocks are drifting near their record heights on Thursday, as oil prices jump after President Donald Trump announced “massive” new sanctions on Russia’s crude industry.  Big U.S. oil companies helped drive the market higher, including gains of 1.3% for Exxon Mobil, 3.4% for ConocoPhillips and 4.1% for Diamondback Energy.  The hope is to convince Russia’s president, Vladimir Putin, to end the brutal war with Ukraine, and sanctions could constrict the global flow of oil.
